main event: A round, brightly lit object was observed moving rapidly in Holt, Michigan on June 21, 1964.
interesting points: The object was sighted for approximately 1.5 to 2 minutes,The object appeared to have a brownish-orange color and was about 800 to 1000 feet in altitude,Two observers witnessed the event, one being a high school teacher,No sound was heard from the object,The case was classified as a probable meteor or satellite based on its appearance and movement.
witness description: one high school teacher and a friend
